CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 11, 1961, pg. 10, reads: "Seeking Jobs At Kroger's - Officers and members of the Greater Pittsburgh Improvement League (GPIL), upset because of the lack of Negro workers in Kroger Stores in Pittsburgh, last week picketed the Kroger Centre Avenue Store in Oakland. Among those in  the line were, left to right:... Eunice Washington; Robert L. Williams, a registered pharmacist and co-captain of the team effort, and Marian Webb.  The GPIL reported that picketing will resume this week if there's no settlement. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Greater Pittsburgh Improvement League (GPIL) members, Eunice Washington, Robert L. Williams, and Marian Webb, wearing sandwich boards inscribed "Please! Do not patronize Kroger's, their percentage of Negro employment is very low..." protesting on sidewalk beside Kroger grocery store, Oakland
